runs.comm: hits a decent length outside off, de Kock goes back and blocks. Late decision to do so, think he was trying to hit it more powerfully with the bottom hand
flighted on middle and leg, de Kock works it away to deep midwicket

big turn! Big bounce! Kicks off the pitch, a puff of dust as it turns square and goes well past the edge of the bat, and the wicketkeeper too. First slip wouldn't have thought he'd get in the game that way
this one goes straight on, and is a touch shorter. AB's deep in his crease as he produces a fine late cut
slinks forward to the pitch of the flighted delivery outside off and drives to short cover
width offered, some more created as he kicks that front foot aside. Opens up his shoulders and crashes the shorter delivery through cover
leans forward and slaps a fuller delivery outside off into the covers. Good work by the fielder to his right
brings him forward again and de Kock taps it to mid-on. Single there, single taken
pushed through quicker, and the direction is down leg too. Mushfiqur isn't quick enough to get across. These are easy runs being gifted with a bright red bow
another awful delivery down leg, Mushy manages to jerk across to his left better this time but he grabs at the ball. Poor work from both bowler and keeper.
fullish on leg stump, AB tucks it through square leg. The fielder has a distance to move to his left, dives, but can't stop it
flighted on middle, knocked to short midwicket
fuller on middle, bowler then parries a drive from de Villers to the short midwicket fielder
hits a good length right on middle, AB respects it with a firm and straight bat
launches into a sweep, not sure he connected with the middle or the top edge because it ballooned away. No protection at the long leg boundary
that's off the meat! Rushes forward, nearly gets to the pitch and powers it away with the bottom hand against the turn. Great drive over extra
moves around the wicket to target the leg stump and prevent giving the left-hander any room. Tucked to midwicket
feigns making room to upset the bowler's rhythm. Bowler follows him, so far so good for de Kock's plan as he moves across to the normal position and sweeps. Gets a top edge over the keeper
tickled around the corner and de Kock pulls his partner though for a quick single
eased away to deep midwicket for a single. Lots more intent from South Africa has seemingly put Bangladesh's spinners off
skirts down leg, de Kock flays at it but can't connect
full and a shade outside off, de Kock swipes it to mid-on. That's the famous Mustafizur offcutter, but it's pushed too full to grip into the pitch
picks the gap to the left of fine leg. Seam up delivery angled in on middle and leg, de Kock clips it off his toes
adjusts his length. Makes it shorter, but de Kock is comfortably behind it. Rolls the wrists to send it to deep square leg
shortish and outside off, de Villiers waits for it to arrive and then taps it on top of the bounce to deep point. That's the offcutter again, but AB's watched it quite carefully
another off cutter on middle, de Kock works it smartly to midwicket. Already it appears the pitch is quicker than on Sunday
good length and outside off, sliced to cover
appears to make room, but the bowler follows him. AB is wary of the trajectory and nudges it to mid-on
some turn back to the left-hander as Shakib goes around the wicket. de Kock stays beside the line and pushes to extra cover
nicely tossed up on middle, AB drives calmly to mid-on. Or it would have gone there but midwicket is quite alert
arm ball! Nearly goes through AB as he jumps back and away from the line to cut. Just about connects
flighted in on middle and leg, AB goes for a big sweep and gets a top edge. Goes to the left and doesn't carry to short fine leg
moves away from the line of a flighted delivery on middle and leg and drives sweetly to the left of mid-off
fullish on off stump, AB caresses it to cover

has AB in all sorts of bother with the offcutter! It's a shade back of a length, grips in the pitch and stops on the batsman. The best in the world, who was looking to flick it away and then is suddenly surprised by the ball rearing up. Gets the outside and leading edge. Doesn't reach as far as cover
the offcutter again, but this is too short and too wide. Crashed away to the deep cover boundary. This is going to be a fun little battle
goes for another cut shot, but the Mustafizur cutter stops on the batsman. Hits the inside edge and dribbles to cover
guides it past gully with the open face. Awful throw from the deep gets South Africa an extra run. Tamim, the fielder, looks a little aggrieved there. Possibly at himself

he's allowing de Villiers to free his arms. AB is happy to stay back, wait for that extra bit and hammer it through extra cover. He has such a fine ability to adjust himself to the pace of any pitch. Like a human tuning fork
flighted on the pads, swept to short fine leg
carefully worked away behind square leg, two yell the two batsmen and it's well on. Another awful throw from deep square leg, Shakib can't be bothered to get behind it either. Sloppy work
beats him with the arm ball! Loopy delivery on middle, AB was looking for some turn. Plays an extra cover drive, his inside edge is beaten and so is short fine leg
nips down the track and works it away to deep midwicket
advances, but Shakib pulls his length back and round-arms it outside off. Forces de Kock to block
that time he doesn't adjust to the batsman racing down. De Kock surprises the wily Shakib and sends the ball soaring away to the midwicket boundary
fuller delivery just outside off, AB calmly dabs it to the bowler's right. Long-on's miles away in the deep
shortish and outside off, de Kock claps it away to the sweeper
full and curling in, AB rolls his wrists on impact and sends it to long-on
another misfield! Costs them a single. de Kock eases a shortish offcutter away to the left of point. Sabbir moves in line with it, but then lets it through
hammered back at the bowler, who dives the wrong way while in his followthrough. Gets a hand to it and deflects it to midwicket

they're taking the fielders on, Mashrafe is fuming at his team's work so far. De Kock had basically given up, and a few feet away from making his ground, he watches a trigger throw racing past the stumps. Push to extra cover should have been fatal, could have been if the fielder had waited for Mash to get in position
swipes a fuller delivery on off stump to long-on
good length ball outside off, but AB's been sweeping bowlers much faster than Sarkar. So no surprise that he gets low and works this away to short fine leg
neatly done. Manufactures some runs off a yorker just outside off. Plants the open face down and picks out deep third man
another yorker just outside off, AB looks to slash it through the covers. Ends up with an inside edge
only a matter of time. Skips down the track, takes a possible yorker into a full toss and slaps it away to the wide long-on boundary
length this time and AB has slugged it away to the right of deep midwicket. Not that far right, mind you. It was just struck so pristinely

full and wide outside off, de Kock slashes it away to the sweeper who hustles across to it fine. Gets his hands down fine. And then looks up to see the ball trickling to the boundary. Terrible work from Bangladesh this afternoon
good length ball with width, de Kock hammers it to a deepish mid-on
full on middle and off, clipped wide of long-on
bang! Who cares about AB when QdK hits em like that. It's a sluggish length ball, with enough room to free those arms. De Kock settles into a good base and slogs it away
attempts a yorker, ends up with a low full toss which is driven to long-off
hits the yorker perfectly! De Villiers still tries to squeeze it out through the covers. Even he isn't that lucky
looks to take a good length ball on middle stump with a reverse sweep. Doesn't connect because it isn't as well floated up
this one is well tossed up, squeezed to cover
moves away outside leg and scoops a catch to midwicket! Lots of bottom hand in the stroke, but it was too full to dig out with that much aggression. And once he didn't pick the gap, he was a goner
gets down the track, to the pitch of a tossed up delivery and drives to long-on
stays back to a flatter delivery and works it away through midwicket
flighted just outside off, Duminy lunges forward and sweeps strongly. Besides that, he has placed it well to the left of the only fielder in the deep. Good batting
that was a little silly. Gets down the track, swipes against the turn, gets a leading edge that shoots straight up. A few fielders are looking at each other, before finally Shakib calls for it.

massive appeal from behind the stumps, and the umpire yields. AB was forward and looking to tickle it to fine leg. Was there bat to this? If there was, it's the faintest one possible. Doesn't seem to be any conclusive deflection and AB's walking off a little angry. Judging from that at least, this is a lucky break for Bangladesh
flighted down leg, nudged behind square leg
tossed up on off stump, defended

another caught behind appeal. But the keeper and the close-in fielders are absolutely convinced. And there seemed to be a noise as ball passed bat. Gets a good length ball to turn and has the batsman reaching in front of him with his hands. Miller nearly overbalances in the process. Again, can't say conclusively that the edge was taken. Mushy had to juggle to take it cleanly. But this is good for Bangladesh. Two quick strikes and they're back in it. What an over from Nasir!
pushed through on middle and leg, defended. Or tries to. Struck on the pads, but this might have been sliding down
flighted on and around leg stump, clipped away to deep square leg
flighted on leg stump, driven strongly to long-on. Miller used his feet well there
pushed down leg, Faf was looking to glance it away. Can't connect, keeper's not alert either. Wides
down the track to a fuller delivery on leg stump, worked away to long-on
stays back to a slightly shorter delivery on middle. Looks to cut, only gets it off the bottom of the bat. This pitch it still slow enough to confound the new batsman
but one of the class of Faf adjusts quicker than the rest. Keeps back and decides to pull the same shorter delivery on middle past short midwicket
good length on off stump, Miller works it to the left of the non-striker
flighted outside off, Miller leans into a pretty compact cover drive. This isn't his style of pitch. Making runs here will be a good statement
goes back and across to a good length ball on off stump and clips it past midiwcket. Faf is putting so much pressure on Bangladesh by his running and he's back easy for two
moves back to a good length ball that zips into his pads. Kept a shade low as he inside edges it. Should have been forward
that's good work in the deep. Midwicket gets across to his left and slides to get in line with a neat little lift from Faf. Neat use of the feet too

short and outside off, Faf waits on it and cracks it away behind point. Sabbir presents another example of how not to field the ball. Goes down with one hand and comes up with only a couple of blades of grass
fuller delivery on off stump, pushed to long-off
fullish and just outside off, worked away to deep midwicket

gets a touch more bounce than the batsman thought. It's the offcutter that stays in the pitch enough to get some bite. Miller goes for a forceful drive and is beaten. Good work there from Mushy, rising with the ball and taking it cleanly. Top work
drills a drive to cover as Mash bowls full and a shade wide
short and wide, Miller has crashed it away behind point. Easy to put those away on a slow pitch. Especially with Miller's power
good length ball outside off, pushed to cover
shortish and outside off, slapped away to the sweeper
flighted on middle and leg, Miller leans forward and over the ball to tuck it to backward square leg
drags a fuller and flatter one from outside leg with a reverse sweep. He'd premeditated the shot and credit to him for reaching it and
more orthodox this time as he works the angle into him and picks it away through midwicket
short on middle and leg, short-arm pulled to long leg
a shade short to the left-hander, pulled strongly to deep midwicket
gets down the track and works a good length ball from off stump through to deep midwicket
gets some turn as he tosses the ball right on on middle and leg. Faf was looking to flick it away and gets a little leading edge
jumps back and slams a short delivery to short cover. Excellent effort from the man diving to his left
looped up on middle, Faf is into the slog too early and gets an inside edge to short fine leg
whipped down to long-on as Shakib is bowling a lot slower to try and flummox the batsman
with him concentrating on giving the ball a bit more air, it's gripping the pitch more and cuts back at him sharply. Miller was in a position to cut, but has to temper his instincts
full and outside off, punched down the ground to long-off. Appears the cross-seamer, as opposed to the cutter
yorker just outside off, squeezed out to deep third man. When fast bowlers are told to keep the seam upright, this young man does some amazing things with it!
full toss outside off, Miller is a bit too eager to punish it. Gets an thick inside edge to fine leg when he was perhaps looking for a slog over midwicket
that's gone straight up! It's the cutter again from Mustafizur again, on middle and leg. Faf was going for a whip over midwicket again. Gets it off the toe and the keeper has ages to get under it
full toss on off stump, whipped away to deep square leg
runs down the track, gets a full toss for his trouble. But then he gets only an inside edge through to the keeper
width outside off, Miller waits a bit too far on it I think. Goes for the cut and comes up with nothing. Looks dreadfully disappointed
that's a full toss down leg, Miller makes it worse by rushing at it and then flicks it away to the long leg delivery. Timely strike
a little nervous with his footwork, whether to get forward or back. But its short so he has the time to adjust and crash it away to deep point
full toss on leg stump, worked away to deep midwicket for a couple. Great running
third full toss of the over and it's been thumped over midwicket. Help yourself stuff from Shakib and Rossouw does, emphatically
shows off his skill there. Straight down the ground. Advances on the bowler, who pushes it across outside off to try and beat him. But Rossouw reaches it and slams it into the sightscreen
good start! It's a very full delivery just outside off, Miller was trying to swipe it away. Only gets an inside edge to short fine leg
wide full toss, MIller gets the bottom of the bat on the drive to long-off
takes the yorker on middle and sends it to deep midwicket. Good work in the deep to keep that to just a single
full toss way outside off, Miller appeared to lose balance as he tries his beat to reach for it. Throws his hands at the ball and the timing is sublime
hits the yorker just outside off, Miller punches it to long-off and thinks of a second. Not there

shapes for a reverse swat, Mustafiz doesn't blink as he bowls full and just outside off. Rossouw is just a shade better as he clears that front leg and cracks it down the ground. Phew. he's a powerful bloke
